adrFormatAddress: 22 Reade St, New York, NY 10007-1216, USA

originalText.text:
I'm utterly flabbergasted after the experience I was made to suffer through when I sought help from the NYC Commission for Human Rights. I was racially profiled and falsely accused of stealing, harassed and embarrassed. It was so bad that even Gap's customer service expressed horror in my experience.

I submitted my claim, waited for the call back, shared my experience with the rep and actually had a date set for an official intake; shortly thereafter, the rep calls back and says my claim isn't within their jurisdiction and I don't qualify as a "protected person"â€¦   Are they serious??? I vividly recall seeing ad campaigns posted by the NYC Commission for Human Rights in which black people were featured with a message condemning racial profiling and other prejudices; yet here they are, going against the very purpose of their existence.

Shame on you guys! Y'all are no better than the bigots and racists whom have divided humanity and made this country such a scary place! Seriously, y'all have to do better; otherwise, make way for whomever has the willingness and integrity to perform the duties as expected. I implore you to make this right.

originalText.text: If i could of gave them a 0 i would, when i gave my complaint, i did read the reviews and already felt defeated, but after going thru the process, i have to say these agencies are pointless, its like if your a worker, forget about going against corporate entities, its almost as if thats who they actually fight for. And not you the tax payer that allows these agencies to stay open. They get alot of complaints and just as fast dismiss or dont do anything at all for you its criminal what these agencies allow companies to do  theres no justice!!!! Dont waist your time.

originalText.text: Word to the wise, go to EEOC or NYS Commission on Human Rights. Do not use these people with your life depending on them. I made the mistake of doing so 2 times and never again. I have serious disabilities. My first time, they closed my case for administrative reasons. I had an inside source find out the real reason and that person said my case wasn't in the public interest. I was a city worker being harassed by supervisors and management in a city agency because of those disabilities, and that's not in the public interest? What kind of nonesene is that? In my second mistake with using these people, I had an online intake appointment scheduled and the phone representative had no idea of what to do when I called to ask why nobody was online. He had me on the phone for 20 min completely lost. The attorney assigned had no idea. His supervisor had no idea of what to do. They have too many cases and not enough staff. Instead of admitting that they fall short. They don't answer the phone and they disappear. When you call them on the carpet for their shortcomings they tell you "I am not your lawyer." So, why am I dealing with you? I only mentioned a few problems with these people which are all 100% fact and truthful. Don't do it. Somebody should sue them!!!

originalText.text: The Mexican or the El Salvadorian Representative on 6/2/23.  Who could not help me. Couldn't even speak English correctly. He had no other resources to give me. A waste of my time.  The Latin receptionist was a sweet heart though. â™¥ï¸ Gracia.
